Texto Adaptado por: 
R R√ìMULO BITTENCOURT‚úÖ
Presidente Nacional de la CDBr-Confederaci√≥n derecha Brasil

De las elecciones de 1994 a 2014, el Partido de los trabajadores (PT) y el Partido Socialdem√≥crata brasile√±o (PSDB) protagonizaron la disputa electoral para el cargo de presidente.  Aparentemente, la disputa era entre dos opositores, pero detr√°s de escena, la realidad era otra. Eran dos partidos socialistas que hac√≠an una falsa oposici√≥n, pero los objetivos ideol√≥gicos eran los mismos.

A pesar de que el PSDB tiene ideas de izquierda m√°s moderadas, algo que los enmarcar√≠a como un centro-izquierda, (Socialistas Fabiano), muchos votantes consideraban ese partido como la v√≠a de la derecha brasile√±a y los partidos de izquierda OCI ocialistas (Marxista y Fabiano) se turnaban en el poder, haciendo una falsa oposici√≥n y enga√±ando al pueblo tonto y muggle, los ignorantes, que no sab√≠an lo que era una ideolog√≠a de izquierda y el mal que hace para una sociedad.

* El Teatro de las tijeras: la pol√≠tica desnuda y cruda con sus estrategias.*

* La Revoluci√≥n Rusa y el Teatro de las tijeras, c√≥mo comenz√≥ todo.*
Categor√≠a: Brasil Paralelo

La Revoluci√≥n Rusa fue el movimiento que puso fin a la monarqu√≠a zarista e implement√≥ el primer r√©gimen comunista de la historia. El movimiento revolucionario cont√≥ con dos grupos principales: los bolcheviques y los mencheviques. Aparentemente, eran grupos distintos, pero ten√≠an un objetivo com√∫n.

* La diferencia entre los dos grupos, los Mencheviques y los bolcheviques hizo que Lenin creara la estrategia del teatro de las tijeras.*

Los mencheviques no deseaban una revoluci√≥n violenta, pero quer√≠an que la transici√≥n fuera pol√≠tica y pac√≠fica. Los bolcheviques ya deseaban la revoluci√≥n comunista a toda costa.

En ruso, "bolchevique" significa mayor√≠a; y "menchevique", minor√≠a. Los mencheviques eran partidarios del socialismo por etapas, tal como predicaba Karl Marx. Cre√≠an que Rusia, al ser un pa√≠s campesino y feudal, todav√≠a necesitaba industrializarse antes de convertirse en socialista y que, por lo tanto, otras naciones la preceder√≠an en este viaje.

Lenin y el origen del Teatro de las tijeras*

Lenin al mando de la revoluci√≥n.

El pueblo ruso era mayoritariamente religioso y viv√≠a bien con el Imperio. El reinado de Alejandro II fue popular y benquisto por la poblaci√≥n. Alexander asegur√≥ estudios y cultura para toda Rusia.
Sin embargo, los revolucionarios ya estaban articulados en el pa√≠s y el movimiento Voluntad Popular asesin√≥ a Alejandro II.

Su hijo, Alejandro III, se dirigi√≥ a una pol√≠tica antipopular, buscando vengar a su padre. Entendi√≥ que las pol√≠ticas populares de su padre abrieron la puerta a la violencia comunista.

El movimiento socialista aprovech√≥ las actitudes de Alejandro III e instig√≥ la revoluci√≥n popular. Sin embargo, la gente a√∫n no deseaba un sistema comunista, y fue all√≠ donde Lenin cre√≥ su famosa estrategia, el Teatro de las tijeras.

English: * CDBR informs:*

* The scissors Theater - the relationship between PT and PSDB*

Text adapted by: 
R√îMULO BITTENCOURT
National president of CDBr - Confedera√ß√£o Direita Brasil

From the 1994 to 2014 elections, the Workers ' Party (PT) and the Brazilian Social Democratic Party (PSDB) starred in the electoral dispute for the position of President.  Apparently, the dispute was between two opponents, but behind the scenes, the reality was different. They were two socialist parties that made a false opposition, but the ideological objectives were the same.

Although the PSDB had more moderate left-wing ideas, something that would frame them as a center-left, (Fabiano Socialists), many voters considered this party as the way of the Brazilian right and the left-ocialist parties (Marxist and Fabiano) took turns in power, making a false opposition and deceiving the foolish and muggle people, the ignorant, who did not know what a left-wing ideology was and the harm it does to a society.

* The scissors Theater - naked politics with its strategies.*

*The Russian Revolution and the scissors Theater, how it all began.*
- Editor: Parallel Brazil

The Russian Revolution was the movement that ended the tsarist monarchy and implemented the first communist regime in history. The revolutionary movement counted on two main groups: the Bolsheviks and Mensheviks. Apparently, they were distinct groups, but they had a common goal.

* The difference between the two groups, the Mensheviks and the Bolsheviks caused Lenin to create the strategy of the scissors theater.*

The Mensheviks did not want a violent revolution, but they wanted the transition to be political and peaceful. The Bolsheviks already wanted communist revolution at any cost.

In Russian, ‚ÄúBolshevik ‚Äúmeans majority, and‚Äù Menshevik " means minority. The Mensheviks were adherents of socialism in stages, just as Karl Marx preached. They believed that Russia, being a peasant and feudal country, still needed to industrialize before becoming socialist, and that therefore other nations would precede it on this journey.

Lenin and the origin of the scissors Theatre*

Lenin leading the revolution.

The Russian people were mostly religious and lived well with the Empire. The reign of Alexander II was popular and well-liked by the population. Alexander secured studies and culture for all of Russia.
However, the revolutionaries were already articulated in the country and the Popular Will movement assassinated Alexander II.

His son, Alexander III, turned to an anti-popular policy, seeking to avenge his father. He understood that his father's popular policies opened the door to Communist violence.

The Socialist Movement took advantage of the attitudes of Alexander III and instigated the people's revolution. However, the people still did not want a communist system, and it was there that Lenin created his famous strategy, the scissors Theater.

* - Watch out!*
